RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 1 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 75. Claiming Purse 11000. (PLUS UP TO $3,850 THRIF) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since April 28 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since March 28 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $4,000, For Each $500 To $3,000 2 lbs. British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $5,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MAKEITORBREAKIT broke sharply and settled off the clear leader while racing one out from the rail entering the backstretch, began to close the gap on the pacesetter approaching the final turn, quickly swept to the lead leaving the final turn, and held EYE BE SEEING YOU safely at bay late to prove best. EYE BE SEEING YOU settled off the early pacesetter while racing two out from the rail entering the backstretch, rallied smartly three wide entering the final turn, and closed willingly two out from the rail in the drive to hold the place. DEBATABLE was off a step slow and trailed the field into the backstretch, rallied five wide from the back of the pack entering the final turn, and closed determinedly seven wide in the drive while gaining late. GWEN away well, but settled well off the quick early pace entering the backstretch, rallied two wide entering the final turn, but needed more late when called upon. MONTE away alertly and sprinted to a clear lead in the opening strides, continued in the run down the backstretch on a long lead, began to shorten stride entering the final turn, was quickly overtaken leaving the turn, and had nothing left for the drive.

ENTRY.NAME: Gwen
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, settled rail, rallied 2 wide, needed more

ENTRY.NAME: Makeitorbreakit
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, settled 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, led, held

ENTRY.NAME: Debatable
ENTRY.COMMENT: step slow, trailed, rallied 5 wide, closed 7 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Eye Be Seeing You
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled 3 wide, rallied 3 wide, closed 3 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Monte
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, clear lead, tired

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 2 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 70. Claiming Purse 11000. (PLUS UP TO $3,850 THRIF) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since April 28 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since March 28 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $4,000, For Each $5 00 To $3,000 2 lbs. British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $5,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: BARNEY GOOGLE unhurried early while dropping back to trail, launched his bid two out from the rail entering the final turn, shifted four wide entering the lane, and closed willingly three wide in the drive to prove best. REMEMBERTHEALAMO broke sharply and raced to the lead from along the rail entering the first turn, dictated the pace in the run down the backside and into the final turn, was no match for the winner late, but battled gamely one out from the rail in the lane, before drifting out nearing the wire and bumping with ROLLIE'S SPIRIT, and finished on even terms with that foe. ROLLIE'S SPIRIT away well and tracked the leader into the backstretch while racing two out from the rail, rallied three wide through the final turn, and closed determinedly three wide in the drive while getting bumped late, and finished on even terms with REMEMBERTHEALAMO. THERE GOES MY HERO away alertly and tracked the pacesetter into the backstretch while racing one out from the rail, rallied two wide entering the final turn, and finished one out from the rail in the drive. ATOMIC HAZE settled off the early pace while racing two wide entering the backstretch, commenced his bid one out from the rail entering the final turn, tipped four wide entering the stretch, but lacked the needed closing response when called upon. CHAMPIOSA settled off the early leaders while saving ground at the rail entering the backstretch, was asked to keep up in the run to the final turn, but weakened over the final furlong.

ENTRY.NAME: dh-Rememberthealamo
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, led rail, rallied inside, closed 2 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: There Goes My Hero
ENTRY.OWNER: Klimes Helen McDonald Jo-Anne and Pring Sharon
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, tracked 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, closed 2 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: dh-Rollie's Spirit
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, tracked 3 wide, rallied 3 wide, closed 3 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Barney Google
ENTRY.OWNER: Roberts-Henson Michelle Henson Brad Henson Randy Henson Dan and Irwin Trevor
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried early, trailed, rallied 3 wide, closed 3 wide, best

ENTRY.NAME: Champiosa
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled rail, weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Atomic Haze
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, closed 4 wide,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 3 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 76. Claiming Purse 12500. (PLUS UP TO $6,250 THRIF) FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since April 20 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since Then Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $8 ,000, For Each $1,000 To $6,000 2 lbs. British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $10,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: TAM TRICKY away alertly and raced to the lead while one out from the rail entering the first turn, controlled the pace in the run down the backside while staying off the rail, continued to show the way two wide into the final turn, and was never seriously threatened late. NO PEOPLE tracked the leader into the backstretch while racing two out from the rail, rallied two wide entering the final turn, and finished willingly three wide in the drive to hold the place while the rider was dealing with a saddle that had slipped back in the late stages of the race. DUXONTHEPOND away well and was allowed to settle off the early pace while saving ground at the rail entering the backside, commenced her bid three wide entering the final turn, and finished five wide in the drive while gaining late. ISLAND LIVING broke sharply and tracked the leader into the backstretch while saving ground at the rail, rallied smartly from along the inside through the final turn, but was unable to sustain her bid in the drive. STOPSHOPPINGSHELLY unhurried early while dropping back to trail, rallied two wide entering the final turn, but failed to make a late impact.

ENTRY.NAME: Stopshoppingshelly
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried early, trailed, rallied 2 wide, never menaced

ENTRY.NAME: Duxonthepond
ENTRY.OWNER: Willow Creek Farms and Chiesa Fabio
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, settled rail, rallied 3 wide, closed 5 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Island Living
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, tracked rail, rallied inside, outfinished late

ENTRY.NAME: Tam Tricky
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, led 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, held

ENTRY.NAME: No People
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked 3w, rallied 2w, closed 3w, saddle slipped

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 4 1 1/16M Dirt CR: 74. Claiming Purse 11000. (PLUS UP TO $5,500 THRIF) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE SINCE JANUARY 1 OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since April 27 Allowed 2 lbs. Such A Race Since March 27 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $4,000, For Each $500 To $3,000 2 lbs. British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $5,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: APPELLANT settled off the early pace while racing two out from the rail entering the stretch the first time, pulled his way into a stalking position entering the second turn, began to advance one out from the rail midway down the backside, tipped three wide to launch his bid entering the final turn, assumed control entering the lane, and drew clear in the drive under confident handling. GORKY PARK settled off the early pace while racing one out from the rail through the stretch the first time, moved into a stalking trip entering the second turn, commenced his bid four wide entering the final turn, and closed willingly two wide in the drive to hold the place. MCMURPHY broke sharply and stalked the leaders through the lane the first time while saving ground at the rail, dropped back to trail in the run to the final turn, rallied from just off the rail through the turn, and closed with late interest three wide in the drive to garner a share. DON WITH THE WIND away alertly and pressed the pace from the outside of AVE'S IN COMMAND entering the first turn, continued to force the issue through the second turn and in the run down the backside, rallied two wide through the final turn, was overtaken leaving the turn, and faded in the late stages. AVE'S IN COMMAND away well and raced to the lead from along the rail entering the first turn, set a pressured pace through the final turn, was quickly overtaken leaving the turn, and weakened in the drive.

ENTRY.NAME: Ave's in Command
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, led rail, rallied inside, weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Gorky Park
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled 2 wide, rallied 4 wide, closed 2 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Appellant
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled 3w, advanced 3/8, rallied 3w, led, drew clear

ENTRY.NAME: McMurphy
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, stalked inside, rallied 2w, closed 3 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Don With the Wind
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, pressed 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, faded

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 5 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 84. Claiming Purse 21000. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since April 28 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since March 28 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $25,000, For Each $2,500 To $20,000 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $16,000 Or Less Not Considered For Allowances). British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $32,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: FLORIDA GATOR settled off the early pace while racing two out from the rail entering the backstretch, rallied smartly two wide entering the final turn, tipped outside leaving the turn, and closed with a rush four wide in the drive to prove best. SMART LAD stalked the dueling leaders into the backstretch while racing just out from the rail, launched his bid three wide entering the final turn, and closed gamely five wide in the drive to get up for the place. SIR BREGOVIC away alertly and dueled for the lead two wide entering the backstretch, continued to battle two wide from between rivals for the lead entering the final turn, put away his pace rivals entering the stretch, and gave way grudgingly late while proving best of the rest. FOREIGN PROTOCOL away well and vied for the lead from along the rail entering the first turn, set a pressured pace from along the rail in the run down the backside and through the final turn, was overtaken entering the lane, and finished two wide in the drive. SLEW'S BAK broke sharply and was allowed to settle off the contested early pace while saving ground at the rail in the run down the backstretch, rallied along the inside through the final turn, but needed more late while finishing along the rail in the drive. BOLD ARCH stumbled badly in the opening strides to get away poorly, rushed up three wide entering the first turn and forced the issue three wide in the run down the backside and into the final turn, struggled to keep up leaving the turn, and faded in the late stages.

ENTRY.NAME: Foreign Protocol
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, vied rail, rallied inside, closed 2 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Slew's Bak
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, settled, rallied inside, closed rail, needed more

ENTRY.NAME: Sir Bregovic
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, dueled 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, gave way grudgingly

ENTRY.NAME: Florida Gator
ENTRY.OWNER: Potozny Larry Langelaan Peter and Wil - A - Way Farm
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled 3 wide, rallied 2 wide, closed 4 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Smart Lad
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked 2 wide, rallied 3 wide, closed 5 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Bold Arch
ENTRY.OWNER: Morrison, John and Kim and Sadler, Robin
ENTRY.COMMENT: stumbled start, chased 3 wide, pressed 3 wide, faded

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 6 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 59. Maiden Claiming Purse 14000. (PLUS UP TO $4,900 THRIF) FOR MAIDENS, FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $16,000, For Each $1,750 To $12,500 2 lbs. British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $20,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: INDYETTA away alertly and vied for the lead from along the rail entering the first turn, set a pressured pace in the run down the backstretch, took a narrow advantage into the final turn, and drew clear late under confident handling. SHESBOURBONONICE broke sharply, but was allowed to settle well back of the contested early pace while saving ground at the rail entering the backside, launched her bid from along the inside entering the final turn, tipped four wide entering the lane, and closed willingly while drifting in late to get up for the place. B C CHU CHU tracked the dueling leaders into the backstretch while racing two out from the rail, loomed a danger while racing three wide entering the final turn, and while no match for the winner in the lane, battled gamely to garner a share. LENT ME TWENTY tracked the leaders in the run down the backstretch while saving ground at the rail, rallied along the inside entering the final turn, and finished from along the rail in the drive. SWEET AS HONEY raced rank in the opening strides, and trailed the field into the backstretch, rallied two wide from the back of the pack entering the final turn, but failed to make a late impact. STAR FINALITY away well and dueled for the lead from the outside of INDYETTA entering the first turn, continued to force the pace in the run down the backstretch and into the final turn, but faded over the final furlong. Following the running of this race there was a stewards inquiry into the stretch run, in particular to SHESBOURBAONONICE, after review there was no change to the original order of finish.

ENTRY.NAME: Indyetta
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, vied rail, led, drew clear

ENTRY.NAME: Star Finality
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, dueled 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, faded

ENTRY.NAME: Sweet as Honey
ENTRY.COMMENT: rank early, trailed, rallied 2 wide, never menaced

ENTRY.NAME: Lent Me Twenty
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked rail, rallied inside, closed rail

ENTRY.NAME: Shesbourbononice
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, settled rail, rallied inside, closed 4 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: B C Chu Chu
ENTRY.OWNER: Danard Don B and Danard Sue
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked 3 wide, rallied 3 wide, closed 2 wide,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 7 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 75. Claiming Purse 11000. (PLUS UP TO $3,850 THRIF) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE SINCE FEBRUARY 28 OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since April 28 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since March 28 A llowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $4,000, For Each $500 To $3,000 2 lbs. British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $5,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: WISE MARKET broke sharply and dueled for the lead from the outside of QUAGMIRE entering the first turn, continued to force the issue two wide in the run down the backstretch and through the final turn, was bumped by his pace rival entering the lane, and drew clear late. QUAGMIRE away alertly and vied for the lead from along the rail entering the first turn, set a pressured pace from along the inside of WISE MARKET in the run down the backside and through the final turn, drifted out and bumped his pace rival entering the lane, and finished from along the inside in the drive to hold the place. ADITYA away well and tracked the dueling leaders in the run down the backstretch while racing along the inside, rallied two wide through the final turn while awaiting racing room, and closed four wide in the drive to get up for a share while gaining late. RING OF KERRY tracked the battling leaders in the run down the backstretch while racing one out from the rail, rallied three wide entering the final turn, but needed more late while finishing five wide in the drive. VALUE MAX settled off the early pace while saving ground at the rail entering the backstretch, rallied along the inside entering the final turn, but failed to make a serious late threat. PADDY D'ORO settled off the pace while racing three wide entering the backside, rallied two out from the rail entering the final turn, but lacked the needed closing response when called upon.

ENTRY.NAME: Value Max
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled rail, rallied inside, never menaced

ENTRY.NAME: Aditya
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, tracked inside, rallied 2 wide, closed 4 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Paddy d'Oro
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled 3 wide, rallied 3 wide, lacked response

ENTRY.NAME: Quagmire
ENTRY.OWNER: Henson Lorie Klimes Helen and Pring Sharon
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, vied rail, rallied inside, closed rail, held place

ENTRY.NAME: Ring of Kerry
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked 2 wide, rallied 3 wide, closed 5 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Wise Market
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, dueled 2w, rallied 2w, bumped 1/8, drew clear
